summary.p: This manuscript is an incomplete version of a Tamil-Portuguese dictionary. At first impression it is based on Antão De Proença's (1624-1666) dictionary even though not all the entries from Antão are reported. The comparison between the two manuscript has not been systematic.
From f. 2r up to f. 11r both Tamil entries and Portuguese meaning are found. From f. 11v onwards and till the end of the manuscript, only the Tamil entries have been copied.
Description based on the online digitized version.

support.p: Lined paper, with lines written in pencil.

extent.measure: 2 front guard leaf + 102 + 2 back guard leaves (u1 + U1 + u2)

collation.desc: the front cover. Shelfmark on recto.
2 folios = front guard leaf. No foliation. In the first folio: shelfmark on recto. Verso blank. On the second folio: Title in French. Verso blank.
102 folios= Tamil-Portuguese Dictionary. Arabic pagination (1-102). Parallel Tamil pagination.
1 folio = ownership statement on recto. Blank verso.
2 folios = back guard leaf. No foliation. Blank recto verso.

layout.p: The page has upper, bottom, right, and left margins drawn with pencil.
Apart from the two columns, where the first one contais the Tamil headword, the second one the Portuguese meaning, the layout of the page is further organised in rows in grey pencil.

handNote.desc: As stated in the paratext of second level (see Muru 2020) on the guard leaf (f. 1r), the Portuguese portion of the Dictionary was copied by Ariel in 1849.. Edouard Ariel.

As stated in the paratext of second level (see Muru 2020) on the guard leaf (f. 1r), the scribe for the Tamil portion was Rattinam who copied it in 1848..
The Periya Ra ற is written with a double loop.
The puḷḷi is sporadically used in intermediate and final position.
An horizontal stroke is used as diacritic for differentiating long ā from ra.

additions.desc: There are two different stamps. The first one is a red circle containing an eagle and the writing Bibliothèque Impérial MSS. This is the stamp in use from 1852 to 1870 (cf. stamp n. 36 in Josserand and Bruno 1960: 282). The second one is a red oval containing the writing Don n°. They appear on the recto of the first folio where ownership statement is. Theeagle stamp is also found on f. 102v.

origin.origDate: 1848 and 1849. Internal date. See u1 and U1, f. 1r. Dated to 1760 by Vinson and Feer (1866-, f. 53r, no. 210224 . 223) on unstated grounds.

provenance.p: Owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequested by Édouard-Simon Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868: 177-224).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.
